titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Lists of treasury warrants which are fully completed from the Virginia Land Office, 1775-1787
titlestmt.author: Claire Radcliffe

titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Lists of treasury warrants which are fully completed from the Virginia Land Office, 1775-1787
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia LOI 28
titlepage.author: Claire Radcliffe

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Lists of treasury warrants which are fully completed from the Virginia Land Office, 1779-1785

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia. Land Office. Lists of treasury warrants which are fully completed from the Virginia Land Office, 1779-1787. Accession Land Office inventory entry no. 28, State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Archives Branch, Richmond, VA 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Accession LOI 28 transferred by the Secretary of the Commonwealth, 1948.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The act which established the previous Land Office next hit passed the General Assembly on 22 June 1779. The register was the head of the Office and was appointed by joint ballot of both houses of the legislature.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: These records contain four lists, one undated and one each dated 1779, 1785, and 1787, giving the name of the warrantee, the number of acres in the warrant, and its number. The entries on each list are in no particular order.
